definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: Each side will cut its arsenal to below 1,700.
sentences.chinese: 雙方均將其核彈頭數量減少到1，700枚以下。

sentences.english: He grabbed the pack with the FENRIS warheads, and swung it over his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 他抓起裝着芬里斯核彈頭的揹包，甩上了他的肩膀。

sentences.english: India has successfully launched a long-range intercontinental ballistic missile able to carry a nuclear warhead, officials say.
sentences.chinese: 印度成功發射一枚可以攜帶核彈頭的洲際彈道導彈。

sentences.english: Yes. And from this state of accelerated motion, it launches a nuclear missile. Sokolov.
sentences.chinese: 然後在這種加速運動的狀態中發射核彈。

sentences.english: But the United States will not conduct new nuclear testing, and will not develop new nuclear warheads.
sentences.chinese: 但美國將不進行新的核試驗，也不發展新的核彈頭。

sentences.english: Scientists will soon be able to observe the first instants after a nuclear warhead detonates.
sentences.chinese: 科學家不久將能觀察到核彈頭爆炸的第一瞬間。

sentences.english: North Korea has the bomb and Iran may soon follow suit.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮有核彈而伊朗可能不久會步其後塵。

sentences.english: World should bann the nuclear bombs.
And why not just whack the Iranians before they get the bomb?
sentences.chinese: 還有爲什麼我們不能在伊朗搞出核彈前轟掉伊朗？

sentences.english: Burma wants to have rockets and nuclear warheads.
sentences.chinese: 賽登溫說，“緬甸想擁有火箭和核彈頭。

sentences.english: At these very high temperatures the nonfissioned parts of the nuclear weapon are vaporized.
sentences.chinese: 在這樣的高溫下，核彈的非裂變部分將被氣化。

sentences.english: Rebels in the Tauri System claimed they had nukes to trade.
sentences.chinese: 陶利星系的叛軍聲稱他們有核彈來交易。

sentences.english: Or what if, upon crashing, one of the nukes had exploded?
sentences.chinese: 或萬一，在墬機之外，一個核彈爆炸了呢？

sentences.english: Di Jian has a person operating from within in coordination with outside forces and supply already, he found two nucleuses successfully to play.
sentences.chinese: 狄堅早已有內應和接應，他成功地找到了兩枚核彈。

sentences.english: Then iran might pull out its secret stash of nukes and blow up the planet.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗可能會拉掉偷藏起來的核彈，把整個地球炸掉。

definition: to catapult/to launch/to eject (from a plane)/to shoot
